授業方法: Seminar. Based on weekly readings and class discussions, students will gain a broad understanding of Modern Japan. At the beginning of each class students will present a summary of the assigned readings followed by class discussions that will be supplemented by materials from the instructor.

第2回: Japan’s Development after World War II: Hiroshima and Post-War Japan.
Reading of assigned reading and preparation for class discussion.
第3回: Reading of assigned reading and preparation for class discussion.
第4回: Life on the Margins: Homeless, Working Poor and Day Laborers
Reading of assigned reading and preparation for class discussion.
第5回: From Rural to Urban: Community and Neighborhood
Reading of assigned reading and preparation for class discussion.
第10回: Disaster Prevention and Natural Disasters in Japan Exporting Japan: Media Culture and its perception in East Asia
Reading of assigned reading and preparation for class discussion.
第11回: Field Trip: The Great Hanshin Earthquake Memorial Museum and Disaster Reduction Center, Kobe
第12回: Exporting Japan: Media Culture and its perception in East Asia
Reading of assigned reading and preparation for class discussion.
第13回: International Relations: Japan's Security Alliance and the Peace Constitution
Reading of assigned reading and preparation for class discussion.
第14回: Civil Society, Social Movements and Protest
Reading of assigned reading and preparation for class discussion.
トピック.授業外学習2: Beside the study required outside class specified above students will also have to summarize and present one of the class readings and write a text summary.

教科書/Required texts0: A reading list of relevant articles will be provided in the first class
